intro: Hieracium strafforelloanum, commonly known as the Strafforello hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to rocky soils. This species is often found in alpine meadows and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture.
